mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, S.W. Tiffey to Anthony Kimmel with reply of Kimmel (copies), 1869 June 24-29
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tiffey, S. W.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Copy of letter from S.W. Tiffey, secretary, to Anthony Kimmel, with a copy of his reply, June 24-29, 1869. Discusses his wish to sell Washington's compass to the MVLA. The last page of the letter is addressed to Nancy Halsted, Vice Regent for New Jersey, and discusses her visit with the president of the steamboat company and his agreement to ship items from Alexandria for free.
